Detailed Description

A structure for storing device modes.

Stores device modes using an update rate.

Note
MT Mk4 devices are better configured using XsOutputConfiguration, this object is supplied for legacy support only.
See also
XsDeviceMode
XsDeviceModePS

Member Function Documentation

void XsDeviceModeR::getPeriodAndSkipFactor ( uint16_t &  period,
uint16_t &  skip 
) const
inline

Compute the period and skip factor from the stored update rate.

This function computes the period and skipFactor fields from the stored m_updateRate field. The maximum error in the update rate is approximately 0.4%, which occurs at 510Hz (= actually 512 Hz). In general, the higher rates are harder to set up exactly.

Parameters
periodStorage for period result
skipStorage for skip factor result
void XsDeviceModeR::setPeriodAndSkipFactor ( uint16_t  period,
uint16_t  skip 
)
inline

Compute the update rate from a period and skip factor.

This function does the reverse of the getPeriodAndSkipFactor function, storing the value in the m_updateRate field.

Parameters
periodThe sample period in 1/115200 secons units
skipThe output skip factor
int XsDeviceModeR::updateRate ( void  ) const
inline

Return the real update rate in Hz.

This may be up to 2Hz different from the value that is set in m_updateRate due to hardware limitations.

Returns
The actual update rate that will be used by the device
